byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Trial begins for Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter, one of six city police officers charged in death of black man Freddie Gray in 2014; Porter, who faces multiple charges including manslaughter, has pleaded not guilty on all counts.
lead_paragraph: Officer William G. Porter ignored Mr. Gray’s cries for help as he lay on the floor of a police van, a prosecutor told the jury, but defense lawyers offered a different version of what happened.

headline.main: Starkly Different Accounts of Freddie Gray’s Death as Trial of Officer Begins
headline.print_headline: Starkly Different Accounts of Death as Trial of Baltimore Officer Begins

snippet: Officer William G. Porter ignored Mr. Gray’s cries for help as he lay on the floor of a police van, a prosecutor told the jury, but defense lawyers offered a different version of what happened.
